014package org.microbean.bean;
015
016import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
017import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
018import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
019
020import java.lang.System.Logger;
021
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Optional;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
029import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
030import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
031import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
032
033import org.microbean.constant.Constables;
034
035import org.microbean.lang.TypeAndElementSource;
036import org.microbean.lang.Equality;
037import org.microbean.lang.Lang;
038
039import org.microbean.lang.type.DelegatingTypeMirror;
040
041import org.microbean.lang.visitor.Visitors;
042
043import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
044import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_int;
045import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.CD_List;
046
047import static java.lang.System.Logger.Level.WARNING;
048
049import static org.microbean.lang.Lang.typeAndElementSource;
050import static org.microbean.lang.Lang.sameTypeEquality;
051
052public final class BeanTypeList extends ReferenceTypeList {
053
054  private static final Logger LOGGER = System.getLogger(BeanTypeList.class.getName());
055
056  public BeanTypeList(final TypeMirror type) {
057    this(List.of(type), null, typeAndElementSource(), sameTypeEquality());
058  }
059
060  public BeanTypeList(final Collection<? extends TypeMirror> types) {
061    this(types, null, typeAndElementSource(), sameTypeEquality());
062  }
063
064  public BeanTypeList(final Collection<? extends TypeMirror> types,
065                      final TypeAndElementSource typeAndElementSource,
066                      final Equality equality) {
067    this(types, null, typeAndElementSource, equality);
068  }
069
070  public BeanTypeList(final Collection<? extends TypeMirror> types,
071                      final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> typeFilter, // the type supplied will be a DeclaredType and will be ARRAY, DECLARED or TYPEVAR
072                      final TypeAndElementSource typeAndElementSource,
073                      final Equality equality) {
074    super(types, typeFilter(typeFilter), typeAndElementSource, equality);
075  }
076
077  // Deliberately unvalidated constructor for use by describeConstable() only.
078  @Deprecated
079  BeanTypeList(final List<DelegatingTypeMirror> types,
080               final int classesIndex,
081               final int arraysIndex,
082               final int interfacesIndex,
083               final Equality equality) {
084    super(types, classesIndex, arraysIndex, interfacesIndex, equality);
085  }
086
087  @Override // Constable
088  public final Optional<DynamicConstantDesc<?>> describeConstable() {
089    return Constables.describeConstable(this.types(), Lang::describeConstable)
090      .flatMap(typesDesc -> this.equality.describeConstable()
091               .map(equalityDesc -> DynamicConstantDesc.of(BSM_INVOKE,
092                                                           MethodHandleDesc.ofConstructor(ClassDesc.of(this.getClass().getName()),
093                                                                                          CD_List,
094                                                                                          CD_int,
095                                                                                          CD_int,
096                                                                                          CD_int,
097                                                                                          CD_Equality),
098                                                           typesDesc,
099                                                           this.classesIndex,
100                                                           this.arraysIndex,
101                                                           this.interfacesIndex,
102                                                           equalityDesc)));
103  }
104
105
106  /*
107   * Static methods.
108   */
109
110
111  public static final BeanTypeList closure(final TypeMirror t) {
112    return closure(t, BeanTypeList::legalBeanType, new Visitors(typeAndElementSource()));
113  }
114
115  public static final BeanTypeList closure(final TypeMirror t, final TypeAndElementSource tes) {
116    return closure(t, BeanTypeList::legalBeanType, new Visitors(tes));
117  }
118
119  public static final BeanTypeList closure(final TypeMirror t, final Visitors visitors) {
120    return closure(t, BeanTypeList::legalBeanType, visitors);
121  }
122
123  public static final BeanTypeList closure(final TypeMirror t,
124                                           final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> typeFilter,
125                                           final TypeAndElementSource tes) {
126    return closure(t, typeFilter, new Visitors(tes));
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link BeanTypeList} containing the set of types {@code t} bears.
131   *
132   * @param t the {@link TypeMirror} whose type closure will be returned as a {@link BeanTypeList}; must not be {@code
133   * null}; must be either a {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED declared type}, an {@linkplain TypeKind#INTERSECTION
134   * intersection type} or a {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type variable}
135   *
136   * @param typeFilter a {@link Predicate} used to {@linkplain Predicate#test(Object) test} a given {@link TypeMirror};
137   * if its {@link Predicate#test(Object) test(Object)} method returns {@code true} for a given {@link TypeMirror}, the
138   * {@link TypeMirror} will be included in the returned {@link BeanTypeList}; may be {@code null}
139   *
140   * @param visitors a {@link Visitors} providing access to a {@linkplain Visitors#typeClosureVisitor() type closure
141   * visitor}; must not be {@code null}
142   *
143   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link BeanTypeList}
144   *
145   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} or {@code visitors} is {@code null}
146   *
147   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code t} is neither a {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED declared type}, an
148   * {@linkplain TypeKind#INTERSECTION intersection type} nor a {@linkplain TypeKind#TYPEVAR type variable}
149   *
150   * @see Visitors#typeClosureVisitor()
151   */
152  public static final BeanTypeList closure(final TypeMirror t,
153                                           final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> typeFilter,
154                                           final Visitors visitors) {
155    return new BeanTypeList(visitors.typeClosureVisitor().visit(t).toList(),
156                            typeFilter,
157                            visitors.typeAndElementSource(),
158                            sameTypeEquality());
159  }
160
161  private static final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> typeFilter(final Predicate<? super TypeMirror> typeFilter) {
162    return
163      typeFilter == null ? BeanTypeList::legalBeanType : ((Predicate<TypeMirror>)BeanTypeList::legalBeanType).and(typeFilter);
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is non-{@code null} and a <a
168   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0.html#legal_bean_types">legal bean type</a>.
169   *
170   * @param t the {@link TypeMirror} in question; must not be {@code null}
171   *
172   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code t} is non-{@code null} and a <a
173   * href="https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0.html#legal_bean_types">legal bean type</a>;
174   * {@code false} otherwise
175   *
176   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
177   */
178  public static final boolean legalBeanType(final TypeMirror t) {
179    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0.html#legal_bean_types
180    // https://jakarta.ee/specifications/cdi/4.0/jakarta-cdi-spec-4.0.html#assignable_parameters
181    switch (t.getKind()) {
182
183    // "A bean type may be an array type."
184    //
185    // "However, some Java types are not legal bean types: [...] An array type whose component type is not a legal bean
186    // type"
187    case ARRAY:
188      if (!legalBeanType(((ArrayType)t).getComponentType())) { // note recursion
189        if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
190          LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " has a component type that is an illegal bean type (" + ((ArrayType)t).getComponentType() + ")");
191        }
192        return false;
193      }
194      return true;
195
196    // "A bean type may be a primitive type. Primitive types are considered to be identical to their corresponding
197    // wrapper types in java.lang."
198    //
199    // When used as a type filter in this class, you'll want to box first.
200    case BOOLEAN:
201    case BYTE:
202    case CHAR:
203    case DOUBLE:
204    case FLOAT:
205    case INT:
206    case LONG:
207    case SHORT:
208      return true;
209
210    // "However, some Java types are not legal bean types: [...] A parameterized type that contains [see below] a
211    // wildcard type parameter [type argument] is not a legal bean type."
212    //
213    // Some ink has been spilled on what it means to "contain" a "wildcard type parameter [type argument]"
214    // (https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-502). Because it turns out that "actual type" apparently means, among other
215    // things, a non-wildcard type, it follows that *no* type argument appearing anywhere in a bean type is
216    // permitted. Note that the definition of "actual type" does not appear in the CDI specification, but only in a
217    // closed JIRA issue
218    // (https://issues.redhat.com/browse/CDI-502?focusedId=13036118&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-13036118).
219    //
220    // This still seems way overstrict to me but there you have it.
221    case DECLARED:
222      for (final TypeMirror typeArgument : ((DeclaredType)t).getTypeArguments()) {
223        if (typeArgument.getKind() != TypeKind.TYPEVAR && !legalBeanType(typeArgument)) { // note recursion
224          if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
225            LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is parameterized with an illegal bean type (" + typeArgument + ")");
226          }
227          return false;
228        }
229      }
230      return true;
231
232    // "A type variable is not a legal bean type."
233    case TYPEVAR:
234      if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
235        LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is a type variable and hence an illegal bean type");
236      }
237      return false;
238
239    default:
240      if (LOGGER.isLoggable(WARNING)) {
241        LOGGER.log(WARNING, t + " is an illegal bean type");
242      }
243      return false;
244    }
245  }
246
247}
